documentation.text:
@notice Updates the DAO metadata (e.g., an IPFS hash).
 @param _metadata The IPFS hash of the new metadata object.

@notice Emitted when the DAO metadata is updated.
 @param metadata The IPFS hash of the new metadata object.

@notice Setter for the trusted forwarder verifying the meta transaction.
 @param _trustedForwarder The trusted forwarder address.

@notice Getter for the trusted forwarder verifying the meta transaction.
 @return The trusted forwarder address.

@notice Emitted when a new TrustedForwarder is set on the DAO.
 @param forwarder the new forwarder address.

@notice Setter for the [ERC-1271](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1271) signature validator contract.
 @param _signatureValidator The address of the signature validator.

@notice Emitted when the signature validator address is updated.
 @param signatureValidator The address of the signature validator.

params._reference: The reference describing the deposit reason.
params.token: The address of the deposited token.

Executed(address,bytes32,(address,uint25.details: The value of `callId` is defined by the component/contract calling the execute function. A `Plugin` implementation can use it, for example, as a nonce.

params.execResults: The array with the results of the executed actions.
params.failureMap: The failure map encoding which actions have failed.

params.metadata: The IPFS hash of the new metadata object.

NativeTokenDeposited(address,uint256).details: This event is intended to be emitted in the `receive` function and is therefore bound by the gas limitations for `send`/`transfer` calls introduced by [ERC-2929](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2929).

params.amount: The amount of native tokens deposited.

params.signatureValidator: The address of the signature validator.

params.callbackSelector: The selector of the callback function.
params.magicNumber: The magic number to be registered for the callback function selector.

params._amount: The amount of tokens to deposit.
params._reference: The reference describing the deposit reason.
params._token: The address of the token or address(0) in case of the native token.

params._allowFailureMap: A bitmap allowing execution to succeed, even if individual actions might revert. If the bit at index `i` is 1, the execution succeeds even if the `i`th action reverts. A failure map value of 0 requires every action to not revert.
params._callId: The ID of the call. The definition of the value of `callId` is up to the calling contract and can be used, e.g., as a nonce.

returns._0: The array of results obtained from the executed actions in `bytes`.
returns._1: The constructed failureMap which contains which actions have actually failed.

params._data: The optional data passed to the `PermissionCondition` registered.
params._who: The address of a EOA or contract to give the permissions.

returns._0: Returns true if the address has permission, false if not.

params._hash: The hash of the data to be signed.
params._signature: The signature byte array associated with `_hash`.

returns._0: Returns the `bytes4` magic value `0x1626ba7e` if the signature is valid.

params._callbackSelector: The selector of the callback function.
params._magicNumber: The magic number to be registered for the function signature.

params._metadata: The IPFS hash of the new metadata object.

params._signatureValidator: The address of the signature validator.

Deposited(address,address,uint256,string.notice: Emitted when a token deposit has been made to the DAO.

Executed(address,bytes32,(address,uint25.notice: Emitted when a proposal is executed.

MetadataSet(bytes).notice: Emitted when the DAO metadata is updated.

NativeTokenDeposited(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when a native token deposit has been made to the DAO.

SignatureValidatorSet(address).notice: Emitted when the signature validator address is updated.

StandardCallbackRegistered(bytes4,bytes4.notice: Emitted when a standard callback is registered.

TrustedForwarderSet(address).notice: Emitted when a new TrustedForwarder is set on the DAO.

deposit(address,uint256,string).notice: Deposits (native) tokens to the DAO contract with a reference string.

execute(bytes32,(address,uint256,bytes)[.notice: Executes a list of actions. If no failure map is provided, one failing action results in the entire excution to be reverted. If a non-zero failure map is provided, allowed actions can fail without the remaining actions being reverted.

getTrustedForwarder().notice: Getter for the trusted forwarder verifying the meta transaction.

hasPermission(address,address,bytes32,by.notice: Checks if an address has permission on a contract via a permission identifier and considers if `ANY_ADDRESS` was used in the granting process.

isValidSignature(bytes32,bytes).notice: Checks whether a signature is valid for the provided hash by forwarding the call to the set [ERC-1271](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1271) signature validator contract.

registerStandardCallback(bytes4,bytes4,b.notice: Registers an ERC standard having a callback by registering its [ERC-165](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165) interface ID and callback function signature.

setMetadata(bytes).notice: Updates the DAO metadata (e.g., an IPFS hash).

setSignatureValidator(address).notice: Setter for the [ERC-1271](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1271) signature validator contract.

setTrustedForwarder(address).notice: Setter for the trusted forwarder verifying the meta transaction.

userdoc.notice: The interface required for DAOs within the Aragon App DAO framework.
